Class BackgroundQueueProcessor<Data,Output>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractQueue<E>
        • java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<Data>
          • BackgroundQueueProcessor<Data,Output>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Iterable<Data>, Collection<Data>, Queue<Data>

    public abstract class BackgroundQueueProcessor<Data,Output>
extends ConcurrentLinkedQueue<Data>
implements Queue<Data>
    The BackgroundQueueProcessor processes data in the background, by running a timed thread. Each BackgroundQueueProcessor is limited to using a single data type for the purposes of managing the queue.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BackgroundQueueProcessor()
      Creates a new BackgroundQueueProcessor with the default interval of 5 seconds.
      BackgroundQueueProcessor(double interval)
      Creates a new BackgroundQueueProcessor with a given amount of time to process all of the data on the queue.

      Stops the BackgroundQueueProcessor and clear the current queue, without processing the data on it.
      ConcurrentLinkedQueue<Output> output()
      Gets a reference to the ConcurrentLinkedQueue for output from the queued data.
      Iterator<Output> outputStream()
      Gets all of the current output as an iterable of Outputs.

      Processes a single item from the queue and returns the appropriate output.
      void start()
      Starts the BackgroundQueueProcessor by enabling the processing to occur.
      void stop()
      Stops the BackgroundQueueProcessor and process the current queue before clearing it and cleaning up the threads.

      Stops the BackgroundQueueProcessor and clear the current queue, optionally processing it before clearing it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BackgroundQueueProcessor

        public BackgroundQueueProcessor(double interval)
        Creates a new BackgroundQueueProcessor with a given amount of time to process all of the data on the queue.
        Parameters:
        interval - time process data in (seconds). An interval of 5s, for example, processes all of the data available every 5 seconds.

      • BackgroundQueueProcessor

        public BackgroundQueueProcessor()
        Creates a new BackgroundQueueProcessor with the default interval of 5 seconds.
        See Also:
        BackgroundQueueProcessor(double)

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the BackgroundQueueProcessor by enabling the processing to occur. Once started, it is important to call stop(boolean), stop(), or abort() before exiting your program. Otherwise, this thread will not exit.

      • stop

        public void stop(boolean finish)
        Stops the BackgroundQueueProcessor and clear the current queue, optionally processing it before clearing it.
        Parameters:
        finish - whether or not to process the data before clearing the queue

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the BackgroundQueueProcessor and process the current queue before clearing it and cleaning up the threads. Same as calling stop(boolean) with true.

      • abort

        public void abort()
        Stops the BackgroundQueueProcessor and clear the current queue, without processing the data on it. Same as calling stop(boolean) with false.

      • outputStream

        public Iterator<Output> outputStream()
        Gets all of the current output as an iterable of Outputs. This is another ConcurrentLinkedQueue. Note: not guaranteed to contain all of the output so far because it is only weakly-consistent.
        Returns:
        iterator over the current output

      • output

        public ConcurrentLinkedQueue<Output> output()
        Gets a reference to the ConcurrentLinkedQueue for output from the queued data.
        Returns:
        ConcurrentLinkedQueue of output

      • process

        public abstract Output process(Data datum)
        Processes a single item from the queue and returns the appropriate output. Note: this should be overridden during instantiation.
        Parameters:
        datum - the item to process
        Returns:
        output from the processing
